steps.title: Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).

steps.title: Prepare the parsnips.
steps.content: Prepare the parsnips. To prepare the parsnips, wash 2 lbs. of medium parsnips under cold water, peel them, and cut them diagonally into 1/2-inch (1.3 cm) slices. The result should resemble uneven medallions.

steps.title: Toss the parsnips, olive oil, and salt together in a bowl.
steps.content: Toss the parsnips, olive oil, and salt together in a bowl. Toss 2 lbs. of medium parsnips, 2 tbsp. of extra-virgin olive oil, and 1 tsp. of Kosher salt together in a bowl.

steps.title: Spread the parsnips in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet.
steps.content: Spread the parsnips in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Dot them with 2 tbsp. of melted butter.

steps.title: Roast the parsnips
steps.content: Roast the parsnips for 20 minutes.

steps.title: Use tongs to turn the parsnips and roast them for another 15 minutes.
steps.content: Use tongs to turn the parsnips and roast them for another 15 minutes. Roast them until they're brown and tender. Then, remove them from the oven and transfer them to a plate.

steps.title: Season the parsnips.
steps.content: Season the parsnips. Season the parsnips with salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle them with 2 tsp. of finely chopped fresh Italian parsley.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy these parsnips while they are hot.

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 350ºF (176ºC).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 350ºF (176ºC). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare the parsnips.
steps.content: Prepare the parsnips. Trim the root and leaf ends of 1-1/2 lbs. of parsnips. Scrub them with a vegetable brush as you rinse them under cool water. Peel the parsnips and julienne them, cutting them into long thin strips similar to the shape of long French fries.

steps.title: Place the parsnips in an ungreased 2-qt baking dish.
steps.content: Place the parsnips in an ungreased 2-qt baking dish.

steps.title: Dot them with 1/4 cup of melted butter.
steps.content: Dot them with 1/4 cup of melted butter.

steps.title: Add 1/4 cup of water to the baking dish.
steps.content: Add 1/4 cup of water to the baking dish. The parsnips should be submerged in the water, which will cook them once it boils in the oven.

steps.title: Sprinkle the parsnips with the spices.
steps.content: Sprinkle the parsnips with the spices. Sprinkle the parsnips with 1/2 tsp. of dried oregano, 1/2 tsp. of dried parsley flakes, 1/4 tsp. of salt, and 1/8 tsp. of pepper.

steps.title: Cover the baking dish and bake the parsnips for 45 minutes or until they are tender.
steps.content: Cover the baking dish and bake the parsnips for 45 minutes or until they are tender. After 35 minutes or so, you can check to see how tender they are by poking them with a fork.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy these parsnips while they are hot. You can enjoy them on their own or as a side to a meat or vegetable-based dish, such as chicken or eggplant.

steps.title: Prepare the parsnips.
steps.content: Prepare the parsnips. Trim the root and leaf ends of 6 parsnips. Scrub them with a vegetable brush as you rinse them under cool water. Then, peel them and use a knife to quarter them lengthwise.

steps.title: Cover the parsnips with water in a large saucepan.
steps.content: Cover the parsnips with water in a large saucepan. Cover the saucepan.

steps.title: Boil the parsnips over medium high heat for about 10 minutes.
steps.content: Boil the parsnips over medium high heat for about 10 minutes. Boil them until they are tender. After 7 minutes, you can check them by poking them with a fork. When they are boiled, drain them to remove the water.

steps.title: Combine the flour and seasoning salt in a plastic bag.
steps.content: Combine the flour and seasoning salt in a plastic bag. Place 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour and 1/2 tsp. of seasoning salt in a sealable plastic bag and shake it to combine the ingredients.

steps.title: Dip the parsnips into 1/2 cup of melted butter and place them in the bag.
steps.content: Dip the parsnips into 1/2 cup of melted butter and place them in the bag. To coat the parsnips, shake the bag to toss them with the seasoned flour.

steps.title: Heat the remaining butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
steps.content: Heat the remaining butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. It should take about one minute for the butter to be heated enough to sizzle.

steps.title: Add the parsnips and cook them until they're golden brown.
steps.content: Add the parsnips and cook them until they're golden brown. After 2-3 minutes, turn them over with a spatula to cook both sides evenly. If they still need more time to be tender and golden brown, keep flipping them over or gently turning them with a fork until they are ready.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy these fried parsnips while they are hot. You can use them as a replacement to French fries and pair them with a sandwich.

steps.title: Boil the parsnips.
steps.content: Boil the parsnips. Boiling parsnips is a simple and quick way to enjoy their natural flavor. Here is what you should do to boil the parsnips: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Salt the water if desired. Trim the root and leaf ends of the parsnips. Scrub the parsnips with a vegetable brush while rinsing under cool water. Peel any part of the outer parsnip that is not favorable to eating. Place the parsnips into the boiling water and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 5 - 15 minutes, until the parsnips are tender.

steps.title: Steam the parsnips.
steps.content: Steam the parsnips. Steaming the parsnips is another quick and easy way to cook them that does not require the use of butter or other spices during the process -- you can add any butter, salt, pepper, or other spices later. Here is how you can steam the parsnips: Trim the root and leaf ends of the parsnips. Scrub the parsnips with a vegetable brush while rinsing under cool water. Peel any part of the outer parsnip that is not favorable to eating. Put the whole parsnips into a steamer and place over boiling water. Steam for 20 - 30 minutes.

steps.title: Microwave the parsnips.
steps.content: Microwave the parsnips. Once you've trimmed the root and leaf ends of the parsnips and scrubbed them under cool water, there are only a few things you need to do to cook the parsnips in the microwave. Here is how you do it: Quarter the parsnips lengthwise. Put 2 tbsp. (28.56 ml) of water into a microwave safe dish. Place the parsnips into the dish and cover. Microwave on high for 4 - 6 minutes.
